Submit - In an email sent to R. Ast on 28 June 2016, G. Bastianini writes, "Io vorrei segnalare a papyri.info (o comunque in una sede adatta) una correzione di lettura in BGU I 326, col. II 4: là non è scritto "genomenes" (come risulta in tutte le numerose edizioni di questo celeberrimo testo), bensì "geinomenes" (con iota in lacuna): cioè, participio presente - non aoristo!" Indeed, the space between 'epsilon' and 'nu' strongly suggests that 'iota' was written in ligature with 'epsilon'. This reading thus removes from BGU 1.326 an anomaly that has been commented on before (see Bastianini's note to line 7 of P.Bagnall 5v). It has the further consequence of calling into doubt the supplement διαθήκης γενομένης, which is provided in editions of other papyri (see P.Hamb. 1.73.13 <http://papyri.info/ddbdp/p.hamb;1;73>, P.Select 14.30 <http://papyri.info/ddbdp/p.select;;14>, and PSI 4.295.5 <http://papyri.info/ddbdp/psi;4;295>, 13.1325.21 <http://papyri.info/ddbdp/psi;13;1325>). This appears to be based on BGU 1.326, because the aorist is not attested in any extant papyri. Where the formula does survive, it is invariably διαθήκης γεινομένης (l. γινομένης). As a result, these supplements should be changed to διαθήκης γεινομένης.
Finalized - Ready.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - The correction is at lin1. I am inclined simply to restore the form [ἑρμηνεί]α rather than assume a form [ἑρμηνί]α which we then regularise.
